title: What Happens to the Mean and Standard Deviation?
question_text:
The boxplot below represents a data set.

If the minimum value was changed from twenty to twelve, what would happen to the mean and standard deviation of the data set?

choices.text: Both the mean and standard deviation would decrease.
The mean would decrease and the standard deviation would increase.
Both the mean and standard deviation would remain the same.
The mean would increase and the standard deviation would decrease.
Both the mean and standard deviation would increase.

solution:
The mean would have to decrease, since twelve is less than twenty. By process of elimination, we can eliminate Choices 'C', 'D' and 'E'.

The standard deviation is a type of spread. When the minimum value is changed from twenty to twelve, the histogram becomes wider and more spread out. This indicates that the spread will increase, and therefore the standard deviation will increase. We can eliminate Choice 'A' as a result.

Choice 'B' is the correct answer.
